title: Duke tames Tide for school's 18th Final Four bid
content: The top-seeded Duke Blue Devils took the next step in their seasonlong quest Saturday night, defeating the East's No. 2 seed, the Alabama Crimson Tide, 85-65, at the Prudential Center in Newark, N.J., to advance to next week's national semifinal in Texas.

title: Clayton's Curry-like flurry helps Gators escape
content: Florida All-American guard Walter Clayton Jr. caught fire late, leading a comeback over Texas Tech that has the Gators in the Final Four.

title: Sources: Maryland's Willard takes Villanova job
content: Kevin Willard, who led Maryland to the Sweet 16 of this season's NCAA tournament, has accepted Villanova's offer to become the program's head basketball coach, sources told ESPN.

title: Geno on Bueckers' 40: As good as I've seen her
content: Paige Bueckers exploded for 29 of her career-best 40 points in the second half, carrying UConn to an 82-59 rout over Oklahoma in the Sweet 16.

title: Devers first to open year with 10 K's in 3 games
content: Boston Red Sox designated hitter Rafael Devers became the first major league player to strike out 10 times in the first three games of a season.

title: Minus JuJu, USC flexes 'chemistry,' bounces KSU
content: Playing for the first time since learning JuJu Watkins will miss the rest of the NCAA tournament with an ACL tear, the USC Trojans used key contributions from their freshman class to defeat the Kansas State Wildcats 67-61 and advance to the Elite Eight.

title: Lakers answer Redick's challenge, top Grizzlies
content: After Los Angeles coach JJ Redick challenged his stars in a Saturday meeting to use more creativity on the floor, LeBron James and the Lakers later responded with a 134-127 win over the Memphis Grizzlies, an effort in which the club shot 50.6% overall.

title: Oilers' Draisaitl 1st to top 50 goals this season
content: Edmonton superstar forward Leon Draisaitl became the first player in the NHL this season to reach 50 goals, then he added his 51st later Saturday night in dramatic fashion, as the Oilers defeated the rival Calgary Flames 3-2 in overtime at Rogers Place.

title: Women's March Madness: Results, analysis as Elite Eight is set
content: Everything you need to know as the Elite Eight is set in the women's NCAA tournament games on Saturday.

title: What this historic day of home runs says about Aaron Judge, Yankees
content: Judge's three homer game helped New York make long ball history and reminded us just how good the slugger is.

title: NHL Power Rankings: Latest updated poll, plus each team's strength of schedule
content: As the playoff field solidifies, here's how our panel voted, along with each team's slate through April 17.

title: Forecasting next season for women's eliminated top seeds
content: NC State has been eliminated. From portal priorities to incoming recruits, we look ahead to the Wolfpack next season.

title: Inside the unprecedented transformation of Steinbrenner Field
content: The Yankees' spring training facility became the Rays' Opening Day ballpark in just four days. Here's how.

title: Messi scores 2 minutes into return in Miami win
content: Lionel Messi scored two minutes after coming off the substitutes' bench as Inter Miami beat the Philadelphia Union 2-1 at Chase Stadium on Saturday.

title: Trinity Rodman: Back likely never will be 100%
content: USWNT star Trinity Rodman has given a sober assessment of her ongoing back issues, saying she doesn't think it will ever be fully healthy again.

title: Mbappé: 'Very special' to match Ronaldo tally
content: Kylian Mbappé said matching Cristiano Ronaldo's goal tally in his debut Real Madrid season is "very special" after scoring twice in a 3-2 comeback win over Leganés on Saturday.

title: Guardiola: My performance has been 'really poor'
content: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola has said his own efforts this season have been "really poor" as his side struggle to recapture their title-winning form.

title: Canada insists injured Davies got 'proper care'
content: The Canadian soccer federation defended its handling of star player Alphonso Davies after Bayern Munich threatened to take legal action in the aftermath of his serious injury suffered during the Concacaf Nations League finals.

title: Tudor gets unlikely assist in debut as Juve coach
content: New Juventus coach Igor Tudor had a direct role in the Bianconeri's first goal since he replaced the fired Thiago Motta.

title: Forest reach 1st FA Cup semifinal since 1991
content: Nottingham Forest secured a place in the FA Cup semi-finals by beating Brighton & Hove Albion 4-3 in a penalty shootout when Ryan Yates smashed home the winner after the game finished goalless following extra time.

title: Reports: Blitzer close to selling RSL, Utah Royals
content: Billionaire businessman David Blitzer is in advanced talks to sell a large stake in both Real Salt Lake of MLS and the Utah Royals of NWSL after owning both franchises since 2022, according to multiple reports.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Madrid plan shocking move for Fernandes
content: Will Manchester United captain Bruno Fernandes replace Luka Modric in Real Madrid's midfield? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Mohanlal expresses ‘regret’ for political, social themes in L2: Empuraan; confirms cuts to film
content: Mohanlal said it is his duty as an artist to ensure that none of his films harbours hatred towards any political movement, ideology or religious sect

title: Does India need to include the mumps vaccine in its universal immunisation programme?
content: Public health experts say the number of mumps cases has exploded in the past few years across several States; introducing a vaccine into the national schedule however, requires careful consideration

title: Gelatin sticks trigger blast at mosque in Beed, no casualty; two held
content: Heavy security deployed in Ardha Masla village in Georai tehsil after gelatin sticks found in mosque trigger blast in Beed, Maharashtra; two arrested, no injuries reported

title: Amit Shah unveils schemes, projects worth over ₹800 crore in Bihar
content: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, Deputy Chief Ministers, several Union and State ministers and senior officials were also present on the occasion

title: Our festivals show unity in diversity in country: PM Modi
content: Modi highlights festivals, summer vacation, water conservation, and yoga in Mann ki Baat broadcast. Strengthen unity in diversity

title: Need for southern unity has never been greater: T.N. CM Stalin
content: Stalin also criticises RBI allowing banks to charge more for ATM withdrawals, as “institutional extraction”

title: Uttar Pradesh Government bans sale of meat within 500 m of religious places during Navratri
content: Under the provisions of the U.P. Municipal Corporation Act 1959 and the Food Safety Act 2006 and 2011, the Yogi Adityanath Government has directed the officials to take strict punitive action against the violators, the statement said

title: Ugadi Day: Temples witness heavy rush of devotees in Andhra Pradesh
content: Sri Vijayaganapati temple-Srikakulam priests Penta Sridhar Sarma and Penta Nagesh Kumar Sarma performed Abhisekham to the presiding deity

title: Dummy weapons used for film shooting: Madras High Court directs Chennai Police Commissioner to issue certificates, identity cards
content: Justice G.K. Ilanthiraiyan quashes an order passed by the Commissioner of Police on December 20, 2024 refusing to issue the documents to members of South Indian Movies Dummy Effects Association

title: Punjab Police busts trans-border narco-smuggling network, two arrested
content: The DGP said an FIR has been registered under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act (NDPS), and further investigation is underway

title: Chennai-bound flight from Jaipur makes emergency landing after damage to tyre, passengers safe
content: After take-off from Jaipur during climb, ATC informed about a piece of tyre found on runway.  Chennai ATC was informed and a precautionary landing carried out

title: Five transgender traffic marshals join Cyberabad police
content: Starting April, they will be stationed at key junctions, ensuring the smooth flow of vehicles in the city’s ever-busy IT corridor.

title: Vizianagaram lawyer Kotla Mohana Rao bags over 200 merit certificates in national-level quiz contests
content: Kotla Mohana Rao won various online competitions conducted by Central departments in the last one and a half years

title: "Must Ensure Movies Don't Spread Hatred": Mohanlal's Apology After Uproar
content: "My duty to ensure my movies don't harbour hatred": Mohanlal apologises amid uproar over 'L2 Empuraan'

title: A China Connection In Bangkok's 33-Storey Building Brought Down By Quake
content: A Chinese-backed construction firm is being investigated over the collapse of a 33-storey high-rise in Thailand's Bangkok during Friday's 7.7-magnitude earthquake that struck central Myanmar.

title: Live: Death Count Rises To 17 In Bangkok Quake, Over 1,600 Dead In Myanmar
content: The death count from a massive earthquake in Myanmar has risen to 1,644 while 3,408 people were injured, the country's ruling junta said Saturday.

title: Chirag Paswan Asked About His Take On Namaz On Streets. What BJP Ally Said
content: Dismissing the push against Muslims offering namaz on streets, Union Minister and BJP ally Chirag Paswan has said these are "useless subjects" and the country faces several other major issues that need to be discussed.

title: 17 Cuts Planned In L2 Empuraan After Gujarat Riots References Spark Row
content: Malayalam movie L2 Empuraan, which hit theatres on Thursday, will undergo 17 cuts amid the controversy over its references to the 2002 Gujarat riots, the film's production team has confirmed. The new version will be released in theatres next week

title: PM Modi Reaches Nagpur, Pays Tribute To RSS Stalwarts With Mohan Bhagwat
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday visited Dr Hedgewar Smruti Mandir in Nagpur and paid tributes at memorials dedicated to Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) founder Keshav Baliram Hedgewar, and second sarsanghchalak (chief) MS Golwalkar.

title: Comedian Joked 'No One Would Attend Dinner With Trump'. Then This Happened
content: The comedian, Amber Ruffin, has previously criticised Trump and joked that no one would want to attend next month's dinner with him.

title: Who Is Sujata Karthikeyan, Top Odisha IAS Officer Who Got Early Retirement
content: Senior Odisha cadre IAS officer Sujata Karthikeyan has taken voluntary retirement, after the Centre approved her application, instructing the Odisha government to issue the necessary notification.

title: Video: Moment When Plane Crashes Into Minnesota House; All Passengers Killed
content: At least one person was killed after a small plane flying from Iowa to Minnesota in the United States crashed into a house in a Minneapolis suburb Saturday.

title: After Face-Off With Hardik Pandya, GT Star Says "Inside The Field..."
content: Gujarat Titans star bowler R Sai Kishore broke silence on his staredown with Mumbai Indians' captain Hardik Pandya.

title: Why US Is Asking Hundreds Of International Students To Self-Deport
content: Hundreds of international students studying in the US have received emails from the US Department of State (DOS), telling them to self-deport as their F-1 visas (student visas) have been revoked owing to campus activism.

title: "When I Heard...": Eden Gardens Curator Heartbroken Over Pitch Controversy
content: Eden Gardens pitch curator believes the wicket prepared in Kolkata has a lot to offer to spinners. KKR just have to find a way to make the best use of the conditions.

title: "You'll Give Me A Child, Bi**h": Andrew Tate Accused Of Sexual Violence
content: Andrew The lawsuit details allegations of physical and emotional abuse, which Tate denies, calling the claims a "blatant cash grab."

title: "We're Only Dependent On God": Rape Survivor's Father On Asaram Bail
content: With Asaram, who is serving life imprisonment in a rape case, getting fresh interim bail, the survivor's father has said his family now faces increased danger as the self-proclaimed godman "can do anything" to them any time.

title: How To Create Studio Ghibli-Inspired Images For Free Without ChatGPT
content: Whether it's Instagram or X, our social media feeds, at large, are in anime mode! Studio Ghibli portraits have taken the internet by storm in the last 48 hours, with people turning everything -  into Japanese anime-inspired art.

title: Colours of Kashmir
content: Spring in Kashmir is a time of blossoming hope and the local population welcomes the season of new beginnings as the Valley wakes up from winter’s embrace

title: Modi in Maharashtra LIVE: RSS is India’s banyan tree of immortal culture and modernisation, says PM
content: PM Modi began his Nagpur trip with a visit to RSS founder’s memorial, Ambedkar landmark Deekshabhoomi

title: Centre sanctions ₹25 crore to develop tourism infrastructure at Nagarjuna Sagar in A.P.
content: Funds allocated under ‘Challenge-Based Destination Development’ initiative of Swadesh Darshan 2.0 scheme; APTDC will oversee implementation of the project

title: Work towards improving living standards of poor, Minister tells district officials
content: The meeting focussed on the Action Taken Report on 113 issues, some of which were MSP for chilli, identification of land for MSME projects, Crop Cultivators’ Rights Card (CCRC) to tenant farmers

title: Energy Minister seeks Central support to develop green energy corridor in A.P.
content: Gottipati Ravi Kumar urges the Centre to implement fuel adjustment charge policy in a timely manner and ensure the necessary clearance for making amendments to A.P. Electricity Regulatory Commission Act

title: Guntur’s Nallapadu Lake all set to get a facelift, says Union Minister
content: He acknowledged that about 4.5 acres of land within the lake area were being cultivated by Dalit farmers and assured that their livelihoods would be protected through a prior survey before any action was taken

title: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu promises full support to hotel industry in Andhra Pradesh
content: Promising to extend special incentives for those investing in State, he says there is a great opportunity for tourism development in Chittoor and Srisailam

title: Phone tapping: Shravan Kumar Rao appears before SIT for questioning
content: Along with Mr. Rao, a Red Corner Notice was also issued against former Special Intelligence Bureau (SIB) Chief T. Prabhakar Rao, another accused in the case.

title: Light to moderate showers likely in Andhra Pradesh from March 31 to April 4
content: Thunderstorms accompanied with lightning and gusty winds, touching 30 to 40 kmph, are likely at isolated places over North Coastal Andhra Pradesh, Yanam and South Coastal Andhra Pradesh

title: Why has X sued the government over SAHYOG? | Explained
content: What is Section 79(3)(b) of the Information Technology Act? Why is X calling SAHYOG a ‘censorship portal’? Is there a move to bypass the limited safeguards under Section 69A of the IT Act, which allows content blocking only on specific grounds such as national security?

title: Is a revamped GST 2.0 on the cards? | Explained
content: What are the issues raised by the Public Accounts Committee on the working of the GST on collection of taxes?

title: GCDA Budget mulls land pooling for third phase of Infopark development
content: Of the 300 acres, a total of 100 acres will be set apart for IT firms, while hotels, hospitals, sports and recreational arenas will be built in the remaining space; software-backed automated parking lots to be readied at multiple places in Kochi

title: Iftar parties, platform for high and mighty, vehicle of harmony, now out of currency in Uttar Pradesh
content: Ram Naik was the last Governor to host one in 2019, and 2016 marked the last time an Iftar gathering was hosted by a CM — Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav.

title: Rajeev Chandrasekhar: From business to politics
content: The media entrepreneur and former Union Minister, who has been appointed as the BJP’s president in Kerala, says his mission is to see an NDA government in the southern State, which has long remained elusive for the saffron party

title: The power of people
content: More than 9,500 village panchayats in Tamil Nadu do not have elected members to represent the grievances of the residents. T. Ramakrishnan finds out that people are not happy with this void at the grassroots level and have begun to call for elections to these posts without delay.

title: Almost 30% of MHA’s takedown notices to X target posts on Union Ministers, government agencies
content: MHA targeted 1.1 lakh pieces of content this year; notices sent on X posts mocking PM, manipulated video of the HM, satirical video on the MoS for Home; police say SAHYOG portal still in trial stage

title: Park for geriatric patients, aged visitors inaugurated at Vellore GH
content: The need for the park was felt because most of the patients in the unit do not have much physical movement due to space crunch, says the heath official

title: 10 labourers from Bengal kidnapped in Tamil Nadu; rescued in inter-State operation
content: The 10 abducted men were reportedly from Murshidabad and Birbhum districts of West Bengal and headed towards Kerala for work

title: PM visiting Nagpur because RSS is behind election victory, says Congress MLA
content: Move to distribute Saugat-e-Modi kits during Eid, Baisakhi and Easter reflects change in RSS ideology, he says

title: MMU decries ‘religious interference’ in Kashmir
content: Conglomerate expresses resentment over decision to disallow Shab-e-Qadr prayers and Jumat-ul-Vida congregational prayers at the historic and central place of worship, Jama Masjid

title: Jobs in Deocha Pachami being given to Trinamool aides, says BJP’s Suvendu Adhikari
content: The LOP made allegations against Trinamool Rajya Sabha MP Samirul Islam who refuted the charges and said that since work at Deocha Pachami has been going on smoothly, the LOP is making baseless allegations to mislead the people

title: CBI convicts Bihar former Minister and four others in Bitumen scam case
content: The case is related to alleged transportation of bulk Bitumen from Haldia to Road Construction Department (RCD) Hazaribagh via Barauni; Investigation revealed that no Bitumen was transported at all

title: ‘I rushed down 40 floors in 7.5 minutes,’ recalls Thailand earthquake survivor
content: ‘It was the worst time of my life. I was petrified,’ survivor said, ‘Over 1,500 people came down with me. Many had left their phones in their offices in that hurry. Some were without shoes.’

title: Fish and meat shops in Varanasi to remain closed during Navratri
content: The decision has drawn strong criticism from a section of corporators, who argued it will impact the livelihoods of thousands of people

title: ASHAs to step up protest in front of Secretariat
content: They will express their protest by chopping off their hair on the 50th day of their agitation demanding better remuneration

title: Attempts to incite communal strife during Eid and Ram Navami, says WB police
content: The situation at Mothabari in Malda, where clashes were reported between two communities, has returned to normal. Eighteen cases have been lodged in connection to the incident, and 61 people have been taken in custody, police sources said

title: NTPC awaits PPA with Telangana, other States to begin work on 2,400 MW plants in Ramagundam
content: Plans to tap into Coal India arm SECL for feedstock as Singareni Collieries coal price is comparatively high

title: SC notice on plea challenging the use of GeM to outsource public employment
content: Dakshin Railway Employees Union files plea on termination of 152 sanitary workers replaced by outsourced labour hired through GeM portal; SC directs Railways to use the workers’ services while case is pending

title: No attempt should be made to divide nation in the name of language: Rajnath Singh
content: Rajnath Singh expressed concern over Tamil Nadu government prioritising opposition to Hindi over providing education in Tamil for crucial fields like medicine and engineering

title: Ministers often visit Delhi citing ‘official purpose’ but meet Congress central leaders
content: They seem to be keen to demonstrate their loyalty to the high command to ensure a safe berth in the Cabinet in the event of a change of guard or reshuffle of the ministry

title: India-EU Resilience Forum seeks to foster dialogue on non-traditional security challenges
content: India-Europe Resilience Forum fosters dialogue on shared security challenges, emphasising cooperation in critical technologies and raw materials

title: UG student held for alleged impersonation during Plus One improvement exam in Kozhikode
content: The incident reportedly occurred at RAC Higher Secondary School, Katameri, during the improvement exam for English language

title: MGNREGA workers in heatwave-hit Kalyana Karnataka demand slashing mandatory work hours in summer months
content: In previous years, the Union government provided relief by reducing the mandatory workload for full wages during April and May, but an order in this regard is still awaited this year

title: JAC formed as mystery shrouds Pastor Praveen Pagadala’s death
content: The committee is calling for the release of CCTV footage and the post-mortem report, while legal experts push for an independent investigation

title: Lokesh bats for reforms in TDP to infuse young blood
content: Leaders should either go to the next level after serving two terms in their positions, or take a break to let freshers come in from time to time, he says, adding that he is prepared to make way for others having held the current post for the fourth term

title: BBMP to implement Climate Action Plan in select wards, focus on energy efficiency and parks
content: These initiatives aim to bring climate-focused interventions to the grassroots level, ensuring sustainable urban development across Bengaluru

title: Prabhotsavam held at Srisailam
content: Thousands of devotees participate in the Prabhotsavam of Lord Mallikarjuna Swamy and Goddess Bhramarambha taken out on the four ‘mada’ streets of the temple

title: Maharashtra government sanctions ₹13.46 crore for Tukaram Omble memorial
content: Mr. Omble was a Mumbai Police sub-inspector who was posthumously awarded the Ashok Chakra, India’s highest peacetime gallantry award, for his bravery during the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks.

title: KAU unveils ₹258.53-cr deficit Budget for 2025-26
content: Financial assistance for postgraduate and research students as well as allocations for Rural Agricultural Work Experience programme, library enhancement, and various educational initiatives, have been included in the Budget

title: Kerala University under fire as 71 MBA students ordered to retake examination amid loss of answer sheets during evaluation
content: The answer scripts of the Project Finance paper, held in May 2024, went missing from a contract lecturer

title: State-of-the-art blood bank inaugurated in Tirupati
content: The new facility is not just a blood bank, but also doubles up into a central laboratory, stem cell and molecular research centre

title: PM Modi praises RSS for its role in nation-building with Bhagwat by his side
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi praised the RSS for its contributions to India's development during a foundation ceremony in Hingna. He highlighted the organization's humanitarian efforts and underscored the importance of youth in nation-building, emphasizing India's leadership in global crises and the ongoing effort to erase colonial remnants.

title: Kunal Kumra joke row: How parties change stand in free-speech debate
content: India's Article 19 faces scrutiny amid political controversy as parties selectively defend free speech based on power dynamics. Incidents involving comedian Kunal Kamra, opposition figures, and various criticisms highlight the inconsistency in upholding this constitutional right. Experts call for clearer definitions to protect artistic expression and emphasize accountability for misusing restrictions to curb free speech.

title: 'Duty to ensure my movies don't harbour hatred': Mohanlal amid 'Empuraan' row
content: Superstar Mohanlal has apologized for distress caused by political and social themes in his latest film L2: Empuraan. Following backlash, the production team decided to remove contentious elements, with changes suggested by the CBFC. Despite controversies, the film has achieved significant box office success.

title: 'He can do anything to us': Rape survivor's father on Asaram Bapu's fresh bail
content: Asaram Bapu, who is serving a life sentence for raping a minor, has been granted an extension of interim bail by the Gujarat High Court for medical reasons. The survivor's father expressed fears for his family's safety, alleging that Asaram is influencing people and managing to secure multiple bail extensions. Authorities are monitoring the family's security.

title: Ghibli style image converter: Guide to turn your photos into an animation video
content: Social media is currently abuzz with Ghibli-style photo trends, featuring dreamy, pastel images. Utilizing AI tools and hand-drawn art, creators are now turning these into animation videos. This guide explains the step-by-step process to produce your own Ghibli-inspired short animation.

title: A few km apart in Mumbai, a 13°C temperature gap
content: Dense construction and decreasing greenery in Mumbai create varying temperatures across suburbs. In March 2025, Powai recorded 13.1 degrees Celsius cooler than Ghatkopar, highlighting the Urban Heat Island effect. Experts stress the need for more trees and customized climate mitigation plans across different city zones to counter rising heat.

title: PM Modi praises Hanumankind for promoting 'traditional martial arts' in new song
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday praised Kerala-born rapper Hanumankind for promoting India's traditional culture through his song 'Run It Up,' which highlights traditional martial arts like Kalari-payattu. The song has topped the Official Asian Music Chart. PM Modi also extended greetings for Chaitra Navratri, Eid, and other upcoming festivals.

title: With Rs 226 crore income since 2022-23, IMD now a money-spinner
content: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has become a significant revenue generator for the Ministry of Earth Sciences, earning over Rs 226 crore since 2022-23. This income largely comes from aviation meteorological services provided to the Airports Authority of India. Additionally, revenue is also generated through the sale of meteorological data, weather reports, and testing/calibration of equipment.

title: Ghibli-style photo generator in ChatGPT: Fake warning letter from Studio Ghibli goes viral
content: ChatGPT's new feature for creating Ghibli-style photos has gone viral, sparking controversy with a fake cease and desist letter from Studio Ghibli. The letter, now debunked, accused AI applications of copyright infringement. Studio Ghibli clarified they did not issue any warning, and the fake letter had invalid contact details, making it clear it was fabricated.

title: 'Trying to write new story': Ranveer Allahbadia resumes podcast on YouTube
content: YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia has resumed 'The Ranveer Show' after facing public backlash over the 'India's Got Latent' controversy. He expressed gratitude to his supporters and reflected on his growth during the hiatus. Allahbadia emphasized creating responsible content in the future and promised a new phase of high-quality content, particularly focusing on India's history and culture.

title: 'Institutionalised extraction': MK Stalin on hike in ATM cash withdrawal charges
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin criticizes RBI's decision to allow banks to increase ATM withdrawal charges beyond the free monthly limits, calling it 'institutionalised extraction' affecting financial inclusion. He claims the move will burden the poor, particularly MGNREGA beneficiaries, undermining their access to banking services and essential government schemes.

title: How to create Ghibli-style Portraits without paying for ChatGPT Plus
content: OpenAI's GPT-4o update, which creates Studio Ghibli-style portraits, is currently restricted to paid subscription tiers due to high demand. However, users can still generate Ghibli-inspired art for free using alternatives like Gemini, GrokAI models, and other third-party tools, or by leveraging free trials on premium AI platforms.

title: Pak kills own civilians during military op, admits 'unintended consequences'
content: An anti-militant operation in Katlang, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province, resulted in the deaths of 12 suspected terrorists and accidentally killed 10 civilians. Local authorities have promised an inquiry into the tragic incident, and medical aid and compensation for victims' families are being arranged.

title: Nurses protect newborn babies during earthquake in China- Video
content: The viral video shows Chinese nurses protecting newborn babies during the Myanmar earthquake that caused significant infrastructure damage in nearby countries. They heroically held the cribs through violent tremors in a maternity center in Ruili, Yunnan Province, demonstrating exceptional bravery and compassion.

title: Weekly Chinese Horoscope, March 30 to April 05, 2025: These zodiacs need to be cautious
content: Those under the Snake, Monkey, and Dog signs may face challenges this week. Snakes should prioritize rest due to mental exhaustion. Monkeys might encounter workplace disruptions, and Dogs could struggle with balancing personal and external demands. Careful management of responses and decisions is advised.

title: 'Inspires us to serve nation': PM Modi's note on RSS's Hedgewar & Golwalkar
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited the Smruti Mandir in Nagpur, paying homage to the founder of the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS), Keshav Baliram Hedgewar, and the second chief, MS Golwalkar. He left a note highlighting the inspiration drawn from their legacy and values for serving the nation.

title: Expert explains why Narayana Murthy's 70 hours/week working policy might be healthy
content: Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy's suggestion for young Indians to work 70 hours a week has sparked a significant debate. While he believes it will boost productivity and economic growth, critics warn of potential burnout and stress. A neurosurgeon adds that the brain experiences stress differently based on whether one is passionate about their work.

title: Myanmar earthquake released energy of 334 atomic bombs: US geologist
content: A 7.7-magnitude earthquake struck Myanmar, releasing energy equivalent to over 300 atomic bombs and causing more than 1,600 deaths. Aftershocks may persist due to ongoing tectonic activity. Communication blackouts and civil strife hinder damage assessment. India has extended humanitarian aid through 'Operation Brahma', while nearby Thailand also reported fatalities.

title: AIADMK negotiated alliance with Vijay's TVK months before warming up to BJP
content: AIADMK explored an alliance with Vijay’s TVK for the 2026 assembly election but talks collapsed due to TVK's conditions. AIADMK is now engaging with BJP, although its allies like SDPI have expressed opposition to such a partnership. Discussions with BJP continue for a possible alliance.

title: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren-Gautam Adani meet gives ammo to BJP
content: Gautam Adani's recent meeting with Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren focused on mining rights and land acquisition for two coal projects. The BJP questioned the sudden cooperation between the JMM and Adani, citing previous criticisms. The discussion included pending clearances and future investment opportunities, raising eyebrows in the state Congress camp for lack of prior notice to their ministers.

title: 8-year-old Bengaluru boy killed by BBMP truck, mob sets it on fire
content: An eight-year-old boy died and his father was injured in a collision with a BBMP garbage truck near Thanisandra railway bridge. The incident prompted a mob to set the truck on fire, blaming rash driving. The driver, Kodanda, was arrested, and residents voiced concerns about frequent accidents involving BBMP trucks in the area.

title: Calcutta HC not dumping ground for judges with questionable image: Lawyers to CJI
content: Calcutta High Court should not serve as a 'dumping ground' for judges with questionable reputations or short tenures, argue three lawyer associations in a letter to the Chief Justice of India. They are challenging the transfer of Delhi HC judge, Dinesh Kumar Sharma, expressing concerns over alleged misconduct and urging reconsideration of the decision.

title: Hardik Pandya fined after MI maintain slow over-rate vs GT
content: Mumbai Indians captain Hardik Pandya was fined Rs 12 lakh for slow over-rate in their IPL match against Gujarat Titans. This is his team's first offence of the season, in a match they lost by 36 runs. Pandya missed the IPL 2025 opener due to a similar offence. New Code of Conduct rules have introduced demerit points and suspension points.

title: 'Saw man punch Saif at Colaba 5-star': Actor Amrita Arora testifies
content: Actress Amrita Arora Ladak testified in court, stating she witnessed Saif Ali Khan being assaulted by a man at a Colaba hotel's restaurant. This incident involved a confrontation over disturbing noise, leading to additional assault charges against Khan and his associates.

title: No difference of opinion between BJP, RSS: Sangh on PM Modi's Nagpur visit
content: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) said there is "no difference in opinion" with the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) after Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited the RSS headquarters in Nagpur. RSS member Seshadri Chari described the visit as very important and historic. PM Modi also paid tribute to RSS founder Keshav Baliram Hedgewar in Nagpur on Sunday.

title: SSC CGL 2024 final result declared at ssc.gov.in: Check direct link here
content: Staff Selection Commission (SSC) has announced the final results for the Combined Graduate Level Examination (CGL) 2024, releasing results for 219 out of 1,267 candidates whose scores were withheld. The announcement was made on March 12, while some candidates’ results were delayed for various reasons. Applicants can check and download their results directly at ssc.gov.in.

title: From 5.6k to 1.7k, US arrest of illegal desi immigrants dips to 4-year low
content: Indian migrants trying to enter the US illegally face heightened risks due to President Trump's stringent immigration policies. Border arrests of Indians have significantly dropped, and deportations have increased, leading to significant fear among the Indian immigrant community in the US.

title: 'F**k off!': Pandya, Kishore have a heated staredown - watch
content: In a heated IPL clash, Hardik Pandya and R Sai Kishore had a brief confrontation during Gujarat Titans and Mumbai Indians' match. Pandya, who performed well with the ball, failed with the bat, contributing to Mumbai's second loss. Post-match, tempers cooled as the players hugged, putting an end to their on-field spat.

title: 'Multiple fights' at Pentagon City mall in US, shutdown ordered - Video
content: Multiple fights broke out at the Fashion Centre in Pentagon City mall, Arlington, on Saturday, resulting in minor injuries to a police officer, a mall security guard, and one of the three arrested juveniles. The mall was closed early, and police continue to investigate the disturbances.

title: African swine fever kills over 500 pigs in Mizoram; all you need to know
content: An outbreak of African Swine Fever in Mizoram has resulted in the deaths of 503 pigs since March 20. The disease, highly contagious and deadly for pigs, was first detected in Lawngtlai district. Authorities are working to contain the spread and mitigate further losses.

title: 15-hour raid on Amazon, Flipkart warehouses: Fake ISI mark products seized
content: The Bureau of Indian Standards has conducted extensive raids on Amazon and Flipkart warehouses in Delhi targeting counterfeit and substandard products. Thousands of items, including geysers, food mixers, electrical appliances, and sports footwear lacking proper ISI certification, were seized with an estimated value of Rs 70 lakh.

title: Texas high school student brutally attacked while adults stood by- Video
content: A Texas junior high student was violently beaten by another pupil while adults failed to intervene quickly. The assault at Harwood Junior High in Bedford was cheered by peers and left the victim unconscious. A full investigation by the school and local authorities is ongoing.

title: Trump weighs Waltz’s fate after Signal chat scandal: 'Should I fire him?'
content: US President Donald Trump is contemplating firing national security advisor Mike Waltz after a Yemen war plan leak through a Signal group chat involving a journalist. Trump remains supportive of Waltz publicly, but concerns about his connections and media coverage heighten internal discussions.

title: Gujarat HC quotes Pink Floyd, quashes decade-old notices by customs
content: The Gujarat high court cited Pink Floyd lyrics to highlight the customs department's decade-long inaction on show-cause notices issued to Rohan Dyes and Intermediates Ltd in 2009. The court quashed the notices due to the prolonged delay and criticized the authorities for failing to resolve the case since personal hearings in 2012.

title: Happy Ugadi 2025: Wishes, Messages, Quotes, Images, Facebook & Whatsapp status
content: Ugadi, marking the Telugu and Kannada New Year, is a significant festival celebrated with devotion in Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and Karnataka. It signifies new beginnings and prosperity, with essential rituals including oil baths, prayers, and the preparation of Ugadi Pachhadi. Celebrations also involve new ventures and family gatherings.

title: Syria’s transitional government takes office marking shift after Assad’s removal
content: Syria's new government was sworn in, marking a major step since Bashar al-Assad's removal. The 23-member cabinet, without a prime minister, includes diverse religious and ethnic backgrounds. Economic troubles and security concerns remain significant challenges. An agreement with the Syrian Democratic Forces was also signed to merge them into the Syrian army.

title: No survivors after small plane crashes into house in US' Minnesota, says official
content: A small aircraft crashed into a residential home in Minnesota, resulting in the deaths of all passengers on board. The accident caused significant fire and smoke damage to the house. Minnesota Governor Tim Walz and the NTSB are coordinating to investigate the incident.

title: US airstrikes in Somalia kill several Islamic State members
content: The US Africa Command carried out an airstrike in Puntland, Somalia, targeting IS-Somalia positions and killing several operatives. Coordinated with the Somali government, the strike occurred southeast of Bosasso port city. This attack is part of an ongoing counter-terrorism operation, with previous strikes eliminating key IS figures. No civilians were reported harmed.

title: Many international students in US told to self-deport due to ‘activism’
content: International students in the US are being asked to self-deport following an email from the state department, allegedly due to campus activism. Immigration lawyers confirm that social media activities are being scrutinized, leading to revoked visas and terminated SEVIS records, with potential future visa difficulties.

title: Hamas releases new video of Israeli hostage shouting and begging for release
content: Hamas' armed wing released a video of Israeli hostage Elkana Bohbot, pleading with Prime Minister Netanyahu for his release after being held in Gaza for 540 days. Bohbot, captured during the October 2023 attack, questioned why the government hadn't secured the release of all hostages despite the ongoing conflict and bombing.

title: Women's Elite Eight rankings: All four top seeds advance, but UConn is still the 1
content: Paige Bueckers sets a new UConn NCAA Tournament record with 40 points to lead the Huskies past Oklahoma and into the Elite Eight . the 2025 women's tournament shifts to the elite eight . 103-34 vs. no. 15 Arkansas State .

title: Terrifying Video Of High-Rise Pool Captures Moment Earthquake Hit Thailand
